leaseDuration.description: The duration that non-leader candidates will wait after observing a leadership renewal until attempting to acquire leadership of a led but unrenewed leader slot. This is effectively the maximum duration that a leader can be stopped before it is replaced by another candidate.

namespace.description: Override the namespace used to store the ConfigMap for leader election.

renewDeadline.description: The interval between attempts by the acting master to renew a leadership slot before it stops leading. This must be less than or equal to the lease duration.

digest.description: Setting a digest will override any tag, e.g. `digest: sha256:0e072dddd1f7f8fc8909a2ca6f65e76c5f0d2fcfb8be47935ae3457e8bbceb20`.

registry.description: You can manage a registry with `registry: quay.io`.

tag.description: Override the image tag to deploy by setting this variable. If no value is set, the chart's appVersion will be used.

automountServiceAccountToken.description: Automount API credentials for a Service Account.

create.description: Specifies whether a service account should be created

name.description: The name of the service account to use. If not set and create is true, a name is generated using the fullname template.

hostNetwork.description: Specifies if the webhook should be started in hostNetwork mode. Required for use in some managed kubernetes clusters (such as AWS EKS) with custom CNI (such as calico), because control-plane managed by AWS cannot communicate with pods' IP CIDR and admission webhooks are not working Since the default port for the webhook conflicts with kubelet on the host network, `webhook.securePort` should be changed to an available port if running in hostNetwork mode.

mutatingWebhookConfigurationAnnotations.description: Optional additional annotations to add to the webhook MutatingWebhookConfiguration

podAnnotations.description: Optional additional annotations to add to the webhook Pods

podLabels.description: Optional additional labels to add to the Webhook Pods

securePort.description: The port that the webhook should listen on for requests. In GKE private clusters, by default kubernetes apiservers are allowed to talk to the cluster nodes only on 443 and 10250. so configuring securePort: 10250, will work out of the box without needing to add firewall rules or requiring NET_BIND_SERVICE capabilities to bind port numbers <1000

serviceType.description: Specifies how the service should be handled. Useful if you want to expose the webhook to outside of the cluster. In some cases, the control plane cannot reach internal services.

url.description: Overrides the mutating webhook and validating webhook so they reach the webhook service using the `url` field instead of a service.

validatingWebhookConfigurationAnnotation.description: Optional additional annotations to add to the webhook ValidatingWebhookConfiguration

kubernetes-xyz:index:Release.description:
A Release is an instance of a chart running in a Kubernetes cluster.
A Chart is a Helm package. It contains all of the resource definitions necessary to run an application, tool, or service inside of a Kubernetes cluster.
Note - Helm Release is currently in BETA and may change. Use in production environment is discouraged.

atomic.description: If set, installation process purges chart on fail. `skipAwait` will be disabled automatically if atomic is used.

chart.description: Chart name to be installed. A path may be used.

cleanupOnFail.description: Allow deletion of new resources created in this upgrade when upgrade fails.

createNamespace.description: Create the namespace if it does not exist.

dependencyUpdate.description: Run helm dependency update before installing the chart.

devel.description: Use chart development versions, too. Equivalent to version '>0.0.0-0'. If `version` is set, this is ignored.

disableCRDHooks.description: Prevent CRD hooks from, running, but run other hooks.  See helm install --no-crd-hook

disableOpenapiValidation.description: If set, the installation process will not validate rendered templates against the Kubernetes OpenAPI Schema

forceUpdate.description: Force resource update through delete/recreate if needed.

keyring.description: Location of public keys used for verification. Used only if `verify` is true

manifest.description: The rendered manifests as JSON. Not yet supported.

maxHistory.description: Limit the maximum number of revisions saved per release. Use 0 for no limit.

namespace.description: Namespace to install the release into.

renderSubchartNotes.description: If set, render subchart notes along with the parent.

replace.description: Re-use the given name, even if that name is already used. This is unsafe in production

repositoryOpts.description: Specification defining the Helm chart repository to use.

resetValues.description: When upgrading, reset the values to the ones built into the chart.

resourceNames.description: Names of resources created by the release grouped by "kind/version".

reuseValues.description: When upgrading, reuse the last release's values and merge in any overrides. If 'resetValues' is specified, this is ignored

skipAwait.description: By default, the provider waits until all resources are in a ready state before marking the release as successful. Setting this to true will skip such await logic.

skipCrds.description: If set, no CRDs will be installed. By default, CRDs are installed if not already present.

timeout.description: Time in seconds to wait for any individual kubernetes operation.

valueYamlFiles.description: List of assets (raw yaml files). Content is read and merged with values. Not yet supported.

values.description: Custom values set for the release.

verify.description: Verify the package before installing it.

version.description: Specify the exact chart version to install. If this is not specified, the latest version is installed.

waitForJobs.description: Will wait until all Jobs have been completed before marking the release as successful. This is ignored if `skipAwait` is enabled.

appVersion.description: The version number of the application being deployed.

name.description: Name is the name of the release.

namespace.description: Namespace is the kubernetes namespace of the release.

revision.description: Version is an int32 which represents the version of the release.

version.description: A SemVer 2 conformant version string of the chart.

kubernetes-xyz:index:RepositoryOpts.description: Specification defining the Helm chart repository to use.

repo.description: Repository where to locate the requested chart. If is a URL the chart is installed without installing the repository.

kubernetes-xyz:index:KubernetesXyz.description: Automates the management and issuance of TLS certificates from various issuing sources within Kubernetes

status.description: Detailed information about the status of the underlying Helm deployment.

clusterResourceNamespace.description: Override the namespace used to store DNS provider credentials etc. for ClusterIssuer resources. By default, the same namespace as xyz is deployed within is used. This namespace will not be automatically created by the Helm chart.

containerSecurityContext.description: Container Security Context to be set on the controller component container. ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/

deploymentAnnotations.description: Optional additional annotations to add to the controller Deployment

featureGates.description: Comma separated list of feature gates that should be enabled on the controller pod.

helmOptions.description: HelmOptions is an escape hatch that lets the end user control any aspect of the Helm deployment. This exposes the entirety of the underlying Helm Release component args.

podAnnotations.description: Optional additional annotations to add to the controller Pods

podDnsPolicy.description: Optional DNS settings, useful if you have a public and private DNS zone for the same domain on Route 53. What follows is an example of ensuring xyz can access an ingress or DNS TXT records at all times. NOTE: This requires Kubernetes 1.10 or `CustomPodDNS` feature gate enabled for the cluster to work.
